name: org.machanism.machai:gw-maven-plugin
description: GW Maven Plugin (Ghostwriter Maven Plugin) is a Maven plugin that integrates MachAI Ghostwriter guided workflow (GW) document processing into Java/Maven builds. It scans and processes documentation source trees (commonly src/site) using embedded guidance tags and instruction inputs, generating and maintaining consistent, up-to-date project documentation across single-module and multi-module (reactor) builds. The plugin provides goals to run GW processing in reverse module order (gw:gw, processing sub-modules first then parents, and able to run without a pom.xml), to run processing using standard Maven reactor dependency ordering with an option to defer the execution-root project until the end (gw:reactor), and to delete temporary workflow artifacts (gw:clean, typically bound to the clean phase). It supports configuration via Maven properties and plugin parameters, including scan root override (gw.scanDir), instructions locations (gw.instructions), default guidance text (gw.guidance), exclude patterns (gw.excludes), input-file logging (gw.logInputs), multi-threaded module processing for gw:gw (gw.threads), and optional credential forwarding from ~/.m2/settings.xml by specifying a server id (gw.genai.serverId), which maps to GENAI_USERNAME/GENAI_PASSWORD workflow properties. It leverages the org.machanism.machai:ghostwriter library and integrates with Maven core/plugin APIs to operate during build lifecycles and in CI/CD pipelines for automated documentation generation and maintenance.

features.name: gw:gw
features.description: Runs Ghostwriter guided file processing as an aggregator goal that can execute without a pom.xml (requiresProject=false). Processes modules in reverse order (sub-modules first, then parent modules), similar to the Ghostwriter CLI. Supports optional multi-threaded module processing via gw.threads and inherits shared scanning/configuration parameters (gw.genai, gw.scanDir, gw.instructions, gw.guidance, gw.excludes, gw.genai.serverId, gw.logInputs).

examples.description: Run guided workflow processing in the current directory.
Run gw:gw in a directory that does not contain a pom.xml (goal supports requiresProject=false).
Run guided workflow processing for a specific module in a multi-module build.

features.name: gw:reactor
features.description: Processes documents across a multi-module build using standard Maven reactor dependency ordering. Optionally defers execution-root project processing until other reactor projects have completed using gw.rootProjectLast. Inherits shared scanning/configuration parameters (gw.genai, gw.scanDir, gw.instructions, gw.guidance, gw.excludes, gw.genai.serverId, gw.logInputs).

features.name: gw:clean
features.description: Deletes temporary artifacts created by the MachAI Ghostwriter guided workflow document processing under the current module base directory. Typically bound to Maven's clean phase.

examples.description: Delete workflow temporary files for the current module.

features.name: Shared scanning and credential configuration
features.description: Common scan/execute flow used by goals to configure a FileProcessor, apply excludes, set instructions and default guidance, establish scan root (defaults to Maven execution root directory when gw.scanDir is omitted), optionally log input files (gw.logInputs), and forward optional GenAI credentials read from ~/.m2/settings.xml when gw.genai.serverId is provided.
